Reviews.Title: “Hotel apartment living at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Cpayneuk
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked the Carmana Plaza but as soon as I arrived I was pleased I did! Great apartments which are clean and modern giving you a local feel with hotel service! The plaza is across the street from a cool supermarket which also serves hot food to go so you can eat at your own dining table and not have to cook! Combine this with very friendly staff and you have a great place to stay for work or vacation. I would not stay anywhere else in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: I have been in Vancouver on business for two months and it looks as though I'll be here for a while longer. I have been a resident of the Carman Plaza for all that time in the company of my wife. We both enjoy living here immensely. The Carmana is like having your own apartment in the heart of the city with maid service thrown in! I won't repeat what other reviewers have said about the great location but would be remiss if I didn't mention the staff. The ladies on the front desk and the conciergies are so helpful and a delight to deal with. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. The maids who do the rooms not only do a very good job but they too are so pleasant. Indeed everybody, including the less visible members of the staff, have always been so friendly and helpful. We looked at the "executive" suites and the regular ones: we prefer the regular. It is true that the regular suites could not be described as luxurious but they are very comfortable and have everything we need to live here (we do quite a lot of home cooking). The "executive" suites have hard-wood floors instead of carpet and are comparitevely noisy and cold. They also have more-modern furnishings which may be aesthetically pleasing but have much less storage space. Probably not a concern for a short-term stay. There are plans to upgrade all the suites which, for us, would be a backward step. But I can't close this review on a down note. The Carmana is a wonderful place to stay at a reasonable price and even after spending two months in Vancouver we would not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: marialeonor
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel very much. The bedrooms are a little small, but for a short stayed is fine. Very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LFontaine
Reviews.Content: Very receptive personnel, well appointed and super-clean rooms and appartments, good views, walk in 2-12 minutes to most downtown sights, shops and attractions. six minutes walking to the Burrard underground stop to Waterfront and Airport. No restaurant, but an excellent Urban fare across the street with prepared food, eat-in space and groceries. Wine and liquor around the corner, plenty of restaurant choices within two blocks. My fourth stay, and my uncontested preference in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: washman19
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here for business trip and could not pick any faults during the whole stay. Rooms very spacious and very clean, housekeeping service inlcuding the laundry service. No request was too much for the front desk staff who try to get to know you and are always polite. Kitchens in the apartment/rooms are exceptionally well equipped. Beds very comfy. Only minor item was the shower head was not that powerful. Main shopping street, Robson Street is only 100yds away and restaurants are everywhere. Fantastic supermarket directly opposite the hotel (Urban Fare) which makes home cooked food for you to take back to your hotel room. When using the the lift you need to swipe your room key first before pressing the required floor otherwise you will end up going up and down all day. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Carmana Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Norman W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three weeks. Staff very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping service top notch. Had the opportunity of sampling two types of accommodation. Standard with King bed excellent - comfortable furniture and great amenities. Executive with Queen bed - great room with extra space but prefer non leather furniture and carpet in the Standard. Views from both rooms brilliant. Main shopping street from one room and harbour and mountains from the other. Close to all restaurants, shops and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied for the service they provide”
Reviews.Author: alfredcunha
Reviews.Content: Great location of the hotel. stunning views outside, overlooking to the city. Great accommodation and amenities. Friendly staffs and very helpful. Everything you need is always assist by their staff. Feel like home. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: 57Babs57
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Carmana Plaza in Vancouver. There were 5 of us and the two bedroom apartments were plenty big enough. The apartments are well located close to Robson Street and are within walking distance to Gastown etc. They are very clean and tidy and having a fully equipped kitchen is great for breakfasts and even dinner if you don't want to eat out all the time. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again when we next visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely handy as a tourist spot”
Reviews.Author: wishing3467
Reviews.Content: This was our first accommodation on a tour of Western Canada and, after a long flight and an even longer queue at passport control at Vancouver airport, was a very welcome sight. We travelled in an extended family group and my husband, 11 year old daughter and I shared a one bedroom suite. Spotlessly clean, very comfortable beds (my daughter's was a sofabed in the living room area and she got into it at 5pm the day we arrived and slept soundly til 7am the next day - even while we cooked and ate around her!) Bathroom does not have a window but that's not unsusual. Floor to ceiling windows everywhere else making it bright and airy and some lovely views through the tall buildings to Grouse Mountain. Some traffic noise at night from the street below but nothing to bother you (I am a light sleeper and noise bothers me greatly!) A huge deli across the road provided us with most of our food for eating in (quite expensive though!). Kitchen fine for cooking most things. Great restaurants right on your doorstep and an off-license just 2 minutes away selling a huge variety of wines (For UK travellers who might not know, alcohol is not sold in supermarkets so don't be put off having to go to an 'offy' - it really is not at all sleazy) Dining room in our suite was a bit of a 'goldfish bowl' - right up against the window and surrounded by glass. However, our other party were in a 2 bed suite with a much larger living area and dining at night with them was easy - we were able to squeeze 7 around their table. Perfect position to meet the shuttle buses a few minutes away to take you up Capilano and Grouse and easy walking distance to the harbour for floatplanes etc. About a 20 minute walk to Stanley Park - which if you do visit, hire some bikes and go around their cycle route - it's great fun and really safe. Plus the aquarium is defintely worth a visit. Beluga whales up so close you could reach out and touch them! Although this suite hotel does not have any restaurant/bar facilities this is not in the least bit problematic. We found we saved vast amounts of time (and money) having breakfast in our suites, and restaurants are moments away for other meals. There are also lots of takeway facilities nearby that will deliver directly to your door. Really friendly staff on the front desk and the bellboy(?) made helpful suggestions about where to eat and get takeaways from. A great base - not too expensive, comparitively, and just what you need - clean, comfortable and modern with excellent wifi to boot. Not luxurious but not 3 star either! No parking which made it a little difficult when we collected our hire cars for onward journey to Jasper, but with military precision we managed to ensure bags and all members of our little group were ready by the kerb and the lovely bell boy helped us again. Would definitely stay there if visiting Vancouver again and definitely recommend for anyone who's visting Vancouver as a holiday maker. There is so much to do in Vancouver, you won't want to spend much time at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a delight”
Reviews.Author: marcus12345
Reviews.Content: in september stayed in a one bedroom suite for 5 nights i would recommend the hotel very much the staff could not have been more helpfull there is a lot of resturants nearby and a superb supermarket right across the road when in vancouver stay here you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: Great location and all the conveniences of home. Rooms have full kitchens and the Urban Fare across the road makes it very easy to self-cater. Overall the suites are spacious although the bedrooms can be on the small side. This isn't too much of an issue since the rooms have a small storage room, so you can get your suitcases out of the way. I've stayed here several times over the years and it's always my first choice for convenience and location. Service has always been great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Corporate Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley S
Reviews.Content: Though I have viewed the rooms, I have not actually stayed at the Carmana myself. Instead I book them for my colleagues from our other overseas offices who need to travel to Vancouver for business. In almost two years, I have heard only positive things about this property. The rooms are lovely; very spacious with great views . . . and the location can't be beat. The reservations staff are always helpful and friendly, and staff seem to work hard to ensure a good stay is had by all. We will continue to use the Carmana for all of our corporate needs in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_B_Rockhound
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times. My son jokes that he'd like to live there. The apartment suites are stylish, comfortable and functional. Location is great. Staff are friendly, helpful and numerous. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “only problem is that it's known by too many nowadays...”
Reviews.Author: waari
Reviews.Content: Absolutely excellent value for money. Spacious rooms / suites, tidy and well maintained. Free WiFi. Excellent location. No kitchen, but across the street a nice deli with breakfast starting at 7AM.

Reviews.Title: “My second home”
Reviews.Author: Dave834
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Carmana Plaza almost every month over the last 10 years for business and pleasure so I consider it to be my second home! Why do I stay there? Well, it is very conveniently located in the downtown area, the suites are spacious and comfortable, the standard of cleanliness is extremely high and most importantly the staff is very friendly and helpful. Within one block can be found a wide range of restaurants, an Urban Fare (across the street) and a liquor store. The skytrain station is only three blocks away. Stanley Park and English Bay are within comfortable walking range.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: KaitlinVancouver
Reviews.Content: Great rates, and great location .. one block from Robson Street and opposite an Urban Fare. Very central! The apartments are great .. always nice to have an actual kitchen and living room when you are travelling for business or for pleasure. Staff are also great - very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, perfect location and hotel for downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: saidean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Carmana Plaza at the start, and the end, of our Canadian Rockies trip. Stayed for a total of 4 nights on the 11th floor. Service staff was efficient and helpful, bellman was very helpful - even guided us through the maze that is the parking complex to where we can park our car! Location: Can't get more convenient than this. It's opposite the Shangri-La Vancouver so that should be an indication of its centrality. Opposite us is Urban Fare, a gourmet (upmarket) market where you can easily obtain breakfast materials (organic!) for use in your kitchenette. There are 2 nice ramen stalls (we're Singaporean Chinese and can certify the ramen to be pretty good!) on either sides of the block, a London Drugs around the block at Robsons, and of course all sorts of cafes and restaurants nearby (we ate at JJ Beans, Earls, etc). For drivers, it's not hard to get onto the main routes to get out of Vancouver towards Whistler, Stanley Park (very nearby), and the Trans Canada highway to the Rockies. Driving from airport took about 30-45 minutes. Parking is convenient and secure - access card is needed to enter the hotel parking area. Room: See photos. The kitchenette is well equipped with dish washer, coffee machine (using capsules), kettle, cooking hob, microwave, full sized fridge. We just stocked up for breakfast from Urban Fare or the 7-11/London Drugs :) The rooms are quiet - double glazed windows, can barely hear the town traffic noise. Spacious living room and bedroom. The room temperature is controlled by a wall panel, and the shower jet is of good strength. Room cleaning is done daily and newspapers delivered daily as well. Rooms are very clean, no problem there whatsoever. TV has quite a number of cable channels to keep the evenings occupied. And.. there are TONS of wall sockets everywhere, for a gadget hog like me (notebook, ipad, camera, phone, etc) this is very useful! Cupboard at entrance to hang your clothes too :) If bored, just look across the street to the posh Shangri-La and gaze with jealousy lol :) Hotel: As previous TAers have pointed out, rooms are accessed by a secure elevator- you need your access card to press your floor, and a key to open the lock. While archaic, I have no issue with this (never had to worry about your room access card going wonky!) The true test for us was that we were actually looking forward to staying at Carmana on our return back to Vancouver after a 2 week trip around the Rockies (where the hotels were not really that comparable to Carmana). It was like returning to a warm, comfortable, home away from home :) I'd certainly recommend this place to my friends, fellow TAers, and readers :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MB500SEC
Reviews.Content: Carmana Plaza is an unassuming hotel very conveniently located in downtown Vancouver. The entrance is small and easy to miss. The building looks as though it was originally designed as a condo complex. All rooms are actuall suite with seperate living rooms and small kitchens. A real find for the price. In addition overnight parking is reasnably priced and you can come and go as you please.

Reviews.Title: “A great place in the heart of downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 154943Peter
Reviews.Content: My wive and I are often in Vancouver for business and are tired of eating all the time in a restaurant. This is the perfect Hotel for a stay almost like home. The rooms we had are actually suites. Living room with TV, 2 bed rooms 1of it with TV, Kitchen. Across the Hotel is a Save On market with bakery, take out etc. around the corner the Liquor Store and in the same street Restaurants from Fast Food to High End galore. The Service in the Hotel is excellent. The room rates are reasonable, free parking, free water and coffee in-room. In our opinion the best in Vancouver so far

Reviews.Title: “Better places for the same money”
Reviews.Author: spuzzum72
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel. Its clean, modern, well located. But if you don't need a kitchenette, there are better places to stay for less money. I also found the rooms to be a bit bare, and souless. One strange thing is that you get an actual key (not a card) for entry to your room. Its a bit of a hassle to carry compared to a card, and if you lose it, you lose 50 bucks. Staff were efficient, not friendly or overly helpful. I would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect hotel in a very centralized location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeTX
Reviews.Content: Competively priced, modern and conveniently located, Carmana Plaza fulfills their promises. Spending three days in Vancouver, this became our "home base" from which we toured, shopped and traveled. Located smack in the center of things, we easily walked to many places including Robson area shopping, restaurants, harbour, transportation, etc. Especially nice was the convenience to a gourmet grocery store (oppisite side of the street & included a deli, buffet section offering assorted meals, bakery etc), liquor store, fast food places, drugstores etc...most within a block!) The one bedroom apartment/suite was perfect, state-of-the-art and impeccably clean while eliminating any concern about safety or security (your key was needed to electronically gain access to everything...elevator, laundry, fitness center, parking etc.) Even the coffee brewing service stocked in the room was excellent. The bellman were courteous and extremely knowledgeable being right-on with their advice and suggestions. It was certainly nice to be in such a large city and discover a jewel like this. No regrets and this would be our hotel of choice when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lkws
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carmana Plaza for 4 weeks on business. The apartment was nicely furnished, spacious, and had a great view. I have nothing negative to say. Helpful staff, clean and modern furnishings, with a fantastic location. You can walk to just about anywhere you might want to go in the city. Lots of great restaurants nearby. Italian kitchen and Sushi Go were two of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean quiet and spacious.”
Reviews.Author: Dunnaheoin
Reviews.Content: This is our first stay in Vancouver. Great central location. Can walk to lots of shops, restaurants and downtown. Booking over the net from Australia was easy and trouble free. There is free wi-fi which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: italy0743
Reviews.Content: Found this to be a great value. One bedroom apartment in a central location in Vancouver. Will definitely stay again if return to the area. Overall customer service was very good. I only have one minor complaint. Parking passes and $15 per day are required to park in the hotel's garage. The charge is added to your hotel bill. I had a rental car the last night I stayed in the hotel. I picked up the parking pass the day before and forgot to display it in the car windshield. I remembered in the middle of the night (2:30am) that I forgot to display the ticket in the windshield. I called the front desk and was told I may get a ticket if I didn't display the parking pass by 5:00am, and that management didn't own the garage so there was nothing they could do to help with that. I had to wake my husband up and we had to go to the garage in the middle of the night to display the parking pass. I expected more help from management with this situation based on other customer service I received at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absoultely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: friendlyeats
Reviews.Content: found hotel after sticker shock with other Vancouver properties. Wanted to see the area / pre-Alaska cruise. Our stay was perfect! The hotel was quiet, very clean, and well maintained. Kitchen very well stocked. Grocery across the street was high end, but served us well for basics for 4 days (cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, roasted chiken and pizza for dinner!). Loved having the laundry on site. Got to watch fireworks competitioin from our 17 th floor suite, sipping champagne. Doesn't get much better than that! Great stay in a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but a litle empty.”
Reviews.Author: Vigilant420
Reviews.Content: Kitchen has nothing in it. Not even a fork wish I found weird. But that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartments for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: traveller_constant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carmana Plaza in August 2011 for a family holiday in a 2 bedroom apartment. The apartments are spacious with 2 large bedrooms (one en-suite) with a large living room, a good sized kitchen, a separate second bathroom and a large storage area. The apartments are well equipped and spotlessly clean. The location is very central, and just a short walk from the Robson Street shopping area and from a range of good restaurants. Most of Vancouver's central district is within walking distance. Conveniently, there is a good supermarket opposite and there is a coin-operated laundry room in the hotel. Overall, an excellent choice for a well-priced apartment hotel in Central Vancouver. Request an apartment on a high floor to avoid street noise ( the hotel is in a skyscraper).

Reviews.Title: “Our Company was Enthralled!”
Reviews.Author: Ardisg
Reviews.Content: My company had a trade show to attend and we used about 9 rooms at Carmana Plaza. All of my attendee's were thoroughly happy with the rooms. The staff was incredibly considerate thorough out all my reservation changes up until the week of the show. In addition to being supremely helpful in assisting our company with anything they needed help with in Vancouver. Lastly, it is so much nicer to have the option of making a meal in the room than having to find a restaurant every night. And the windows open up for fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE rooms at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: daymannightman
Reviews.Content: You simply can not beat the locations and the view at that price. It was also great to have such a big room. Ideal for families. No room service however and no card keys so dont lose the real key!

Reviews.Title: “The best suite hotel we stayed in during our holiday”
Reviews.Author: AmandaR0
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic suite hotel, well equipped and very clean. Central location. These are real appartments with full size, fully equipped kitchens and bathrooms. They are in an ideal location - very central and you can either walk to the different areas of Vancouver or catch a bus. There is a good, if expensive, supermarket opposite the hotel which also has an eat in area. The appartments were very clean. The only downsides were that there is no pool and the beds are english size doubles (4ft 6), in contrast to the 6ft beds you get in most Canadian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel - No comparison”
Reviews.Author: Baggysurfer
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and this apart hotel for me is the best I stay at worldwide based on value for money, location, friendly and helpful staff, parking, cleanliness and functionality of the room with free internet....... and who needs a restaurant when you have Urban Fare across the road. Excellent hotel / apart hotel and I have been staying on and off for 6 years now....always good, spacious and clean apartments cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and great location”
Reviews.Author: journeyManBallarat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carmana Plaza for two weeks in a standard suite located on the 8th floor. The lounge room was huge and the suite included well equipped kitchen which included a coffee machine. The fridge was huge but a little noisy at night. The bedroom had a large wardrobe with adequate drawers and quality wooden coat hangers. Normally the litmus test is the state of the ironing board and iron - both were spot less. The bathroom had great water pressure good and the hot water was hot, just the way I like it. I am not however a fan of shower curtain though it was very clean. The room had a small balcony which was great to open up to feel the breeze. A supermarket is located across the street, so cooking isn’t a problem or alternatively there are numerous eating out options available within walking distance. A bottleshop is located at the end of the block and arond the corner. The clothes washing facility is located on the 3rd floor and machines and dryers are in good condition. Washing powder is available at reception in single wash packets. The gym doesn’t have a lot of machines but I prefer free weights so it was adequate. Treadmills have LCD screens fitted on the wall in front of them. The reception staff are both friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay at the Carmana Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vancouver in the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: CinemaChick
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my trip to Vancouver where I stayed at Carmana Plaza. Thanks to fellow TA writers, I was led in the right direction to this affordable (for Vancouver) and spacious hotel. Carmana Plaza is a great spot for people who want to be centrally located to a lot of fun things near Downtown and are not necessarily looking for the "standard" hotel experience. Carmana actually was even nicer than we had expected it to be. First off, the hotel staff were very helpful during our entire stay, and the room was both clean and well sized. I knew going in that this was an apartment style hotel, and was pleased to see that they had taken care to provide little details like plates, silverware, etc. I also appreciated that my request to be on the side facing the water was taken into consideration and accommodated (that side faces Alberni, which is also more quiet). As other travelers have said, the grocery store *literally* across the street, Urban Fare, is a nice gourmet shop to bring home some food in case you would like to eat in. There is a separate dining area in the room with a table and chairs to better accommodate meals as well. Carmana Plaza offers a bag check and has gated parking ($15/day) that is key-card access (as are the elevators), which offers an extra sense of security. That being said, we went out at night in the neighborhood and it felt perfectly safe. Also, one note about the parking - you have to enter from an alley that is between Alberni & Robson, and it is underground. Look for the Carmana Plaza sign. I will definitely consider staying at Carmana Plaza the next time I'm in Vancouver. Go Canucks Go!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: A number of my colleagues stayed here for a full week for a conference taking place at the Vancouver Convention Center, and I really liked the Carmana a lot. Most of us were sharing the 2-BR standard suites with 3 or 4 to a suite. While the small bedrooms were tight for 2 people (two single beds, like twin beds), the living space was perfectly adequate and spacious. The balcony was really nice, and I also liked the fact that there were a number of windows you could open, both in the living area and in the bedrooms. Bathrooms were fine, nice, very clean. Kitchen space had everything you need, although the bowls were barely bigger than a paper plate. The Carmana is also a great choice because it is between Robson and Georgia, which are the two main busy streets and Alberni is much quieter with a lot less traffic, particularly at night. There is a wonderful Urban Fare grocery store right across the street (think Canada's version of Whole Foods) where you can groceries, flowers, organics and they have a similar coffee bar and hot food counter like Whole Foods. You can easily walk to the waterfront or convention center in about 10 minutes, and there are plenty of shops and restaurants within a very short walk. Lots of coffee places as well close by. I also think the staff was great, very professional, courteous and helpful. Their concierge was also extremely helpful and friendly, with anything we needed including calling taxis. It's about $35 CAD from the airport via taxi (20 mins or so), but the new Canada Line light rail is also about 3 blocks away and a lot cheaper, so if you don't have a lot of luggage it's a great alternative. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: travel0927
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a lovely surprise, so spacious. We arrived early from a cruise, and a room was available. This is a suite Hotel, so everything, even a little dining room, good kitchen, comfortable lounge furniture. Huge bed with quality bedding, and excellent pillows ,something often overlooked.Very clean. Across the street form a very good Deli/Grocery and Food outlet,and many other restaurants nearby. Minutes from Robson Street, and a short, very nice walk from the Harbor and Stanley Park.Porters so very helpful,and friendly, even offering cold water when we returned , after check out, to collect our luggage. The rates are very reasonable as well. We would recommend to anyone and return another time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - get a high floor!”
Reviews.Author: aMid-aSmi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and can't believe the value for money this place offers. Rooms areapartment style with a small bedroom, bathroom, living room with floor to ceiling windows, fully equipped kitchen, a storage room and a small office type room with a desk. Now whilst it's not modern in styling, it is well looked after and spotlessly clean. Free wifi as well. Couldn't fault the room. Last time we stayed in Vancouver we stayed at the Opus, which is a great (read better) hotel, but it's also more expensive and not in the centre of town. When we go back to Vancouver we will stay here for that reason. Top tip. Book a premium room on the 29th and 30th floor or a Carmana room on the 31st floor. No matter what side of the hotel you are you will have a brilliant view. It's worth paying the few extra dollars to guarantee the view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rincewindcymru
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and couldn't fault it. The room was spotless and huge! The location right in the heart of things. A balcony overlooking Robson Street. The staff were friendly. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dindon80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carmana Plaza Hotel in an Executive Suite for 5 nights in September and had a very plesant stay. The location is excellent, just one block away from Robson Street which is full of shops and restaurants and within walking distance of Stanley Park. Across the road is a nice Supermarket called Urban Fare (a little bit pricey though). We had a car and the main attractions (Capilano Suspension Bridge, Grouse Mountain & Lynn Canyon Park) were within a 15 minute drive. Stanley Park was only a 5 minute drive, if you don't fancy walking there. The room was a very nice apartment, with a sitting room, bedroom, bathroom, full kitchen (oven, hob, microwave, kettle, toaster, coffee maker, dishwasher, cutlery, plates, cups etc.) & there is ample stoarage for suitcases and clothes. A safe, iron & ironing board was also provided. Internet access was available, but at a cost of around $10 per day. Parking was around $15 per day. All the staff we came across were very pleasant and helpful. When we go back to Vancouver we would definatley stay at the Carmana Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment and great location”
Reviews.Author: ph07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bed apartment for 2 weeks in August and have also stayed previously. The Carmana Plaza is in a great location, just off Robson Street so handy for sightseeing downtown. The 2 bed executive street was great, beds big and comfortable, kitchen clean and well equipped and 2 bathrooms handy when travelling with small children. The Carmana Plaza is opposite Urban Fare which is great for stocking up on groceries and loads of places nearby for early morning coffee. Only one problem we encountered, every day the apartment would be cleaned around 4/5pm, just as we returned from a day out and needed to use the apartment. We asked at reception but couldn't seem to get this resolved. A small point an overall wouldn't hesitate to recommend a stay at Carmana Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Sammymon
Reviews.Content: Apartment style hotel located in a quiet street, close to the main Robson Street shopping area. In house gym and laundry facilities available, no restaurant although decent deli and up market supermarket straight across the street. Internet access available but costly, nearby coffee chain provides it free. We stayed on the 25th floor and had great views across the harbour. Will stay here again next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good value and location over 20 years.”
Reviews.Author: patcatAuckland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in Vancouver on our annual visits ever since we first discovered it over 20 years ago. As an apartment hotel, it allows the extra freedom to either dine in or take advantage of the amazing range of restaurants in very near proximity. We have always found everything of interest right at our doorstep and the ability to walk from Canada Place to Stanley Park is part of its charm. The staff, some of them the same ones, are marvellous and have done everything to make our stay comfortable. This was a sad, and possibly, final stay, as my daughters and I bought my husbands ashes home to his birthplace. Thankyou Carmana Plaza for your consistantly good attention to detail and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: NItraveller40
Reviews.Content: THis is an apartment hotel with all the facilities you need with separate bedroom, living room and kitchen. We had an executive suite on 22nd floor with super views out of a floor to ceiling window. We used the kitchen for breakfast and it was much better than a hotel when you came in after sightseeing to relax in your own sitting room. There is a great deli/food market across the road which does take out food of a high quality. There are numerous restaurants in the vicinity. We even had an Indian takeaway delivered to our door !

Reviews.Title: “fabulous accomodation & position”
Reviews.Author: traveller13Melbourne
Reviews.Content: These self contained apartments are great. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was separate from the living room which is perfect if one of you wants to go to bed before the other. They had a separate kitchen with big fridge, stove, microwave & dishwasher. The tea bags, coffee & bathroom products were top quality. The rooms were serviced every day. There is a coin operating laundromat in the building which is very handy. They have doorman so you feel very secure. The position is brilliant. Right in the heart of the city. There is a huge supermarket opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonCarol
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent switched us to this Hotel just before we travelled to Vancouver and we were not disappointed great viewsday and night over the city. The Hotel is close to the City Centre Station on the Canada Line and upon arrival in the city we were helped by a friendly local to locate Albeni Street. Our Suite had everything you would need for a comfortable base in which to explore this beautiful city, and staff are on hand should you need help with local knowledge - they printed off information regarding spas for me and fishing for my partner. This Hotel is within easy walking distance to lovely restaurants and all the shops you could need. You can also walk to Stanley Park from the hotel where the Aquarium is worth a visit just to see the beluga whales. We played the 18 hole pitch and putt in the park and had fun dodging the racoons and squirrels. You can make your way to Grouse Mountain via the sea bus located near Canada Place and local buses stop off at Capilano bridge too on the way through. Highlight of our trip was seeing the Orcas just out of Stevenston (see the fish market here and great fish and chips too). Take a trip to Vancouver Island and visit the B.C. museum in Victoria perfect on a rainy day, we got free tickets from our tour guide when we went to Buchart gardens. We spoilt ourselves with a trip on the Rocky Mountaineer to Whistler and stayed overnight - beautiful scenery and adventure do the Zip wire experience while you're there. Cant fault this lovely city with everything to offer and a friendly welcome too. The Carmana Plaza was a perfect base for our stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family orientated hotel”
Reviews.Author: bb2908
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to a cruise. Location is excellent. Close to restaurants and shops. Opposite a large food store. All rooms are suites- so typically you have 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a small equipped kitchen, balcony and a large living space! Staff were attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EveryOtherYear
Reviews.Content: The Carmana Plaza was a nice hotel to stay in. Our first room at the start of our holiday was very spacious and very clean - with a nicely fitted out kitchenette. Our only complaint was the soft bed - which made for a bad night's sleep. On our stay at the end of the holiday, we stayed on the 30th floor - which had magnificent views over downtown Vancouver. The rooms were both of a very good size.

Reviews.Title: “When we go back to Vancouver, we’ll stay at Carmana again!”
Reviews.Author: ILHA
Reviews.Content: The Room: We had a standard suite with a Modern Interior (room no 804). We really liked it: it is clean, light and everything you need is provided (great kitchen!). We could imagine that some travelers find it a little sterile, but Carmana also offers a more traditional suite. The big plus of the room are the “top-floor” windows and the view (see pictures). A little dissapointing is the fact that you have to pay almost $10 for one day internet... Location: The hotel is located at Alberni st. (a very short walk from Robson st.). Parking your car in a parking lot will cost you an add. $15. There is no breakfast room or restaurant, but…. your in Vancouver: so go out and search for it! If not: there is a Supermarket across the street and a BC liquor store nearby. The downside of the location (in the middle of a city) is the noise early mornings (trucks unloading, trucks emptying garbage containers) Staff: The staff is courteous and helpful. Conclusion: When we go back to Vancouver, we’ll stay at Carmana again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: gdoll
Reviews.Content: Very good location in central downtown Vancouver. This is a clean well run hotel. Although the checkin seemed somewhat impersonal. The underground parking lacked signage, so one could find their way back to the lobby and elevators. The rooms were very spacious, and modern with full kitchen suite facilities. The parking was $15. per nite.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: torking
Reviews.Content: Family on holiday for three nights with two yound kids (7 and 4). Two bedroom apartment on 29th floor. Absolutely great stay. Slept so well. Apartment is a great size and well appointed. Very good kitchen which we cooked in all nights. Plenty of space for everyone. It was a corner apartment with amazing views of the city too. Great location. 20 minutes walk to Stanley Park. <5 minutes walk to various forms of transport and city. 10 minutes to Canada Place. Great supermarket across the road and a liquor store next door. Heaps of restaurants. Front desk staff were great - really went out of their way to help. Room cleaning staff were a little slow. Came home at 4 pm one day and they were just starting our room and wanted it for an hour! But I am nitpicking. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, noisy, very poor indifferent service, ordinary accomodation”
Reviews.Author: levis501
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cheaply constructed, poor soundproofing and the street noise at night is terrible. the room fit out is sparse, and basic. Staff are generally smiling but indifferent to your needs, the hotel has limited resources, and other than the location, there is nothing to recommend about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Vancouver yesterday for the Winter Olympics and had a great time at the Carmana Plaza. All the rooms are suite like, with a full kitchen, dining area, living area, bathroom, and separate bedroom. The best part of this hotel is the location. It is right in the middle of downtown Vancouver and we were able to access all the restaurants and high end shopping within a block or so. The view from the hotel overlooked downtown and the water - excellent location. We needed an extra cot and the hotel set up the cot in our room and it was quite comfortable. Rooms were well appointed to daily. The staff were friendly and were very helpful with directions and guidance. Also this hotel had internet available in the room with no charge and provided bottle water daily. No complaints from me, the Carmana Plaza was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good location, noisy, dreadful service”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: And here's another hotel I won't be staying in again. The Carmana Plaza is based in central Vancouver and is very convenient for business/tourism. The rooms are more like suites, with large beds and a kitchen and a separate living area. Great, I thought, until I was dynamited out of my sleep at 6 am on the following day, a Sunday. I looked out of the window and there was a man with a large water compressor cleaning the sidewalk outside the grocery store opposite. I went downstairs and asked the front desk whether they could ask him to stop. "He has nothing to do with us," was the surly response. "But you must be concerned when people in your hotel can't sleep beyond 6 am on a Sunday, surely?" I asked. They didn't bother to answer me. Business must have been good.

Reviews.Title: “V Nice Apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue45
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Vancouver before & while we thought our accommodation then was excellent so to is the Carmana Plaza. Excellent location 1 block back from Robson with a great supermarket across the road (Urban Fare) a Tim Hortons/Wendys & a bottle shop steps away. The self contained 1 b/r apartment was very modern with stove, microwave etc etc. & views of the city. Only complaint was that the side of the bed near the wardrobe was very tight & did not allow much room at all. Had a snazzy coffee maker & a great utility room to store our luggage. Staff were always courteous & helpful. Internet was at a price but for memory not that expensive. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most comfortable hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Ozzietravellers10
Reviews.Content: We picked The Carmana as it provided a 1-br suite layout that suited us. The glass meals nook was a focal point at night as we looked across the city lights, the kitchen was fully laid out with modern appliances, the lounge area more than big enough for our requirements (we also had our daughter with us using the sofa bed) and the bed and pillows were absolutely the most comfortable we have ever experienced. The BC Liquor store is right next door, Urban Fare (directly opposite), an upmarket deli/cafe/market was really handy, a Tim Hortons/Wendys is just 30 metres away and the best value Japanese restaurant in Vancouver (Oysi Oysi) was right next door! What can I say - the best spot in town - we loved it because it had a real home away from home feel. Hosekeeping was done daily and nothing was ever too much trouble for the service staff, front desk and concierge.We were there for 17 nights and could easily have stayed much longer. I can highly recommend this venue as its location was central to everything, it had fantastic restaurants within a few meters and was a very comfortable suite. Full marks to management.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location: Good value for city centre”
Reviews.Author: sydney_traveller50
Reviews.Content: This was an apartment style hotel room with a kitchen, one bedroom and a pull out sofa bed in the living area. Everything was very confortable and the location was great. A few blocks to a big shopping mall: the Pacific Centre, and right in the mddle of some good restaurants. Right across the road is a large great deli/supermarket with almost anything you could want. It is also quite close (several blocks but easy with pull along luggage) to the Sky rail which gives you the cheapest trip to an airport that I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: packingbags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carmana Plaza at the end of August and next time we return to Vancouver we will stay there again. The hotel and apartment was very clean, staff nice and helpful. Across the road is a superb supermarket called 'Urban Fayre' which had everything you needed to stock the kitchen as well as coffee and deli snacks to take out. Also close by is an 7/11, Tim Hortons and liquor store. The Location is ideal for getting around downtown and we felt very safe in the area. This is good value for money when comparing to the tariffs for similar quality accommodation in downtown in either a 4 or 5 star hotel. Will not hesitate to return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Beautiful Contemporary Rooms, Clean, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: foundationx4
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend recently stayed at Carmana Plaza in Aug/09. The check in process was very easy, the front desk staff were very helpful with all of our requests. We were staying in the carmana rooms, on the 31st floor. For 220 dollars a night, you CANNOT go wrong staying here. It was much nicer than I expected. The room does not feel like a hotel at all. It feels like you are staying in someonses very nicely appointed condo. When you walked in the room it has a spacious front entrance with marble tiles and a closet. The whole room was very new and clean, the windows allowed for amazing views all day. The room had a 42" lcd with 5.1 surrond system, which came in very handy for listening to music. The living room also had a nice glass table for eating. The kitchen had everything you could want for cooking. The room decor is very modern and nice to look at, much better than stuffy 'retro' hotel rooms like fairmont. The balcony had the most amazing view I have ever had in a hotel room. The bedroom was well appointed, with a comfy bed, lcd tv mounted on the bedroom wall and ensuite bathroom. The bathroom was average, it was very clean and new so I cannot complain. The location could not have been any better, you are close to everything you would want to go and see. Bars, Restaurants, Shopping, Stanley Park are all walking distance. In fact, we only took 1 cab the entire trip. I do not have pictures of the suite, but if you google vancouver serviced apartments carmana plaza you will find pics of the rooms. I would highly recommend Carmana Plaza to anyone, I will definitley return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Large Suite”
Reviews.Author: ccollins0822
Reviews.Content: We had a really short visit to Carmana Plaza, arriving at 1am and departing in the morning. However, we found our suite to be very pleasant -- clean, large, comfortable. The desk staff were helpful. The location is very central. Overall, it was a great value and a good choice for us. I would certainly stay here again, especially if travelling for a longer time and we could make use of the kitchen facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: Shain
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a reasonably priced two bedroom, two bath suite with an enclosed balcony with seating, a view of the mountains, a combined living room and dining room area and a fully equipped kitchen. There is a laundromat with 12 washers and dryers as well as an exercise room on the 3rd floor. The hotel is in the main downtown shopping center, two blocks from most major public transportation lines, walking distance to many attractions, and most importantly, right across from one of the most upscale urban markets we have seen anywhere, called "Urban Fare." The hotel also provides free coffee, tea and bottles of water. The downside is that there is no food within the hotel and all of the help is first generation Asian, do not speak English well, and do not know the city very well, so if you are first-time tourist you are pretty much on your own. Also there is no basic information about the hotel in the room, so you don't find out until you're checking out, for example, that local calls are 50 cents each, and it took us a few days to figure out that the bottled water was free and that there was a laundry room in the hotel. There is also no free wifi or other internet (it's $10 a day), so to use your laptop for free you need to head over to the Blenz coffee bar a few blocks away. In terms of the room layout, the room strangely provides an attached bathroom to the bedroom that has two twin beds. The master bedroom with a queen bed is smaller and has no attached bathroom. Those using the master bedroom must use the bathroom attached to the living room, which is the smaller of the two bathrooms. Notwithstanding these oddities, we enjoyed this hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Find!”
Reviews.Author: steveb777
Reviews.Content: We had been loyal Blue Horizon customers for a long time, however after staying at the Carmana Plaza for a night before taking an Alaska cruise, I think I can safely say we now have a new place to call home when traveling to Vancouver, BC. Blue Horizon is still a great hotel/value, however Carmana Plaza ups the ante a bit. Excellent accommodations, location and service bundled into a great value. One block off Robson Street provides easy access, while allowing the hotel to be on a quieter street -- best of both worlds. Right across from a nice market and a couple doors down from a Wendy's/Tim Horton's.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean & good location”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_Herts
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Carmana Plaza for 3 nights at the start of our family holiday in the Rockies, and again for one night before flying home. Great to arrive after a long journey to be greated by courteous staff, and to find such a comfortable and clean place to stay. We had a one-bedroom suite with a sofa-bed for the 2 boys (11 & 15) -additional charge of CAD15/night. The separate kitchen area was small but very well equiped (large fridge, dishwasher, coffee machine & kettle). There's a food shop straight across the street (bit pricey, but lovely choice) plus 7/11 down just a short walk down the street, plus liquor store (supermarkets don't sell alcohol). Great to be able to have breakfast in our room before setting out. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On our return trip we left our luggage at the hotel when checking out, and they ordered a taxi to the airport for us that afternoon. The hotel is in a good location - only a few minutes walk to the water (recommend Cardero's and the Crime Lab for places to eat), and very close to shopping etc on Robson Street. There are Starbucks on just about every corner - great for free internet access if needed. Stanley Park is about a 20 min walk. We hired bikes on Denham Street then cycled right round the Park - best way to see it. There's a good pitch and putt in the Park, and we'd recommend going up the Lookout Tower for great views of the city. We walked everywhere from the hotel, and would highly recommend. Given the location, it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: TheBish
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vancouver and picked this hotel from previous reviews. I have to say that we weren't disappointed. After having just arrived from a 14 hour flight, it was great to be arriving into a comfortable apartment which was more like home than a hotel and easy to crash out in. Having two bedrooms was great as we could put our little girl to bed and still be able to sit up and talk, like we do at home. The ensuite in the main bedroom was also a pleasant surprise as were the lcd TV's and very comfortable beds. The bedrooms were quite compact, but that is fine as you have the large living area. The kitchen came well equipped with cooker, oven, microwave, dishwasher and large fridge as well as coffee maker (tea and coffee are supplied). There is also a large gourmet supermarket directly opposite the hotel, a 7-11 nearby and a liquor store virtually next door. It is also a short walk to many restaurants and shops running parallel to Robson street so a really excellent central location. It is also within walking distance of Stanley Park (approx. 15 - 20 mins). We would have no hesitation in booking it again if we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKh0le
Reviews.Content: I've visited this hotel twice now and will keep coming back. Big beautiful bright room, office, living room, nice enough bathroom and THE MOST COMFORTABLE beds! Location cannot be beat - 5 min from Robson, delis and cafes for breakfast, tons of restaurants for dinner, liquor store right next door which was fantastic when we grabbed a bottle before going to visit friends. Nice little touches like good quality tea in your suite, umbrellas in the lobby, towells that aren't too fluffy-linty or too starchy. Also, the price is pretty hard to beat for what you get!!

Reviews.Title: “You feel like you are staying in someone's condo, but the place is clean and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: ArchiChod
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with very good value. You are just behind Robson Street and near the Vancouver Art Gallery. It isn't too far to walk to Gastown or Denman Street. For business, it's great. The rooms are clean and quiet. You feel like you've moved into a condo, although there are no books and photos of your family. The rooms have a small, fully appointed kitchen which can be quite convenient for breakfast or a late-night snack. For a traveller, it is sometimes nice to be in a hotel that doesn't feel like a hotel. For a small family with children/infants, this is a good place to consider. As for value, this place is hard to beat. The staff are very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbg1Perth
Reviews.Content: We had a very well appointed clean 1 bedroom apartment for our 4 night stay in Vancouver. The kitchenette had everything you would need to prepare your own meals – we ate out only 1 night during our stay. The location was excellent, being very central to Downtown near Robson Street and a supermarket across the street. All the attractions were within a good walk. The friendly staff were knowledgeable and helpful being able to answer all our questions and guide us in the right direction. While we travel, we are constantly using the internet to plan the next leg of our trip and indeed the activities for the next day. It was a shock then to find that the internet fee was quite significant. It was free everywhere else we stayed in Canada. We also had some problems with the hot water. Some mornings the shower water simply never became warm. We never received an adequate explanation for this from the staff. All things being equal though, this is a quality apartment hotel and our problems were minor.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Slick58
Reviews.Content: For 1/2 the price of the big name hotels you will get a very nice 1 bedroom apartment with, living room with TV and VCR with optional pull out bed, King size bed with flat screen TV in the bedroom, full small kitchen, lots of storage and a breakfast nook ( or balcony depending on room) proper quiet heat/AC and full security where your key will only let you to your floor. Secure parking is also available. Although there is no restaurant you are only steps away from many coffee shops, restaurants and fine dining and the heart of downtown vancouver...Robson street. I have stayed here at least once a year for the last 8 years and Carmana never disappoints, It is clean, neat and well kept. My only regret is letting too many people know about it may make it hard to get a reservation when i want!

Reviews.Title: “A real find, great value”
Reviews.Author: ABTravelers
Reviews.Content: Encouraged by other TripAdvisor reviews, we reserved a room at the Carmana Plaza for a long weekend stay. We were not disappointed! The location was excellent, the staff was very friendly and helpful (every morning we were greeted by a chorus of good mornings). Our room was very clean, though not plush, it was spacious! We took advantage of the Urban Fare grocery store across the street and our large kitchen and prepared a meal in our room. Though other reviewers mentioned the safe and convenient parking, it should be noted that check-in parking was a challenge. Alberni is a busy street and there is no curbside parking dedicated for the hotel (one of us stayed in the car doubleparked streetside, while the other checked in). You'll have to pay for wi-fi access (daily charge).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent function and value for the business or leisure traveler”
Reviews.Author: iconicimage
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carmana for three nights. The suites are impeccable; my room had a kitchen, bathroom, living area, dining area, bedroom, small office, and small storage room. There was a large flat screen TV in the living area and a smaller wall-mounted unit in the bedroom; the office had a telephone as did the bedroom. In effect it is more like an apartment than a hotel room. Service was excellent. The location can't be beat if you like the downtown area. There's a grocery store across the street, allowing you to easily stock up for an extended stay. This place is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: TePeLondon_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carmana Plaza for 3 days during our trip to Canada. The apartment was VERY clean and the location couldn't be better. We payed $15 a day for parking and left the car there the whole day as you could walk or cycle everwhere. The staff was very friendly, professional and helpfull. I will recomend this hotel to my friends. We could make our own meals in the apartmant as everything you need is in the kitchen. We save some money this way and after 2 weeks of dining out it was nice to prepare you own meals.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for the independent visitor”
Reviews.Author: SuperStu
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - very good services but (obviously) no restaurant. Very convenient having underground secure parking. Would use again without the slightest reservation. Stylish - clean - great views.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Self Contained Vancouver Choice”
Reviews.Author: inti15
Reviews.Content: The Carmana Plaza is a home away from home. Clean, modern self contained accommodation in down town Vancouver. Simple, clean-lined, Ikea inspired décor. Beds are comfortable, the kitchenettes sufficient, stocked with enough cooking equipment for breakfast and dinner (if you really want to cook) with so many great restaurants at your door step. The staff are always available and friendly and we love the small touches like free seamless internet and umbrellas (always necessary for Vancouver). The laundry on the 3rd floor works well – but it was a pity laundrettes were not originally incorporated into the rooms – given the ample space. The views toward the harbour are typical, spectacular Vancouver. Best: Clean, spacious rooms at a great prices (we paid low season C$155), the staff. Worst: Only 3 lifts leave you waiting at times. Overall if you do not want the frills of a full service hotel, yet the freedom of a daily serviced apartment in a great downtown location then the Carmana is a great Vancouver choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: fremantlewa
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom two bathroom apartment for our two night stay in August. We were travelling with another couple so decided this was the best way to go. Lovely clean apartment - nicely laid out. The couch was a bit worn and had a hole in one of the cushions but other than that perfect. Nice little kitchenette so we could make our own breakfast - a great thing after a month of living in hotels ! Great location - just a block down from Robson Street and a seven-eleven just down the road - great for picking up snacks. The front desk were very efficient and friendly on all of our dealings from checkin, tours and check out. They have a laundry which takes tokens bought from the front desk - another plus for us after all of our travels - not having to find a laundromat ! Internet is available for a daily fee - a bit of a let down after almost every other hotel offered free service. But at least it worked ! Would definately stay there again if we travel that way and have no doubts in recommending it. I notice an earlier review stating one key between four people. We asked for a second key and got it straight away - with no problems. This gave each couple a key so we could do our own things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RanyDanny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Carmana Plaza for the last three years when I travel with my family. Since this is an all suite hotel, this is probably the best feature if you are staying longer than 2-3 days. You have a nice kitchen (very handy to avoid the expensive Vancouver downtown food), clean rooms and a very nice location close to anything and everything in Vancouver. Staff has always been very helpful and, at least on my case, my rate included parking (that tend to be very pricey in any downtown area). Last, but not least, the rates are very competitive. You can have a two bedroom suite in high season (summer) for 200 CAD. That's the same, and even less, you will pay for a standard room in any other downtown location (Marriot, Hyatt, Fairmont).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: skeToronto
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at the Carmana in April. The hotel resembles more a condo than a hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite (4 adults and one toddler). There was plenty of room for all of us - a double bed in one room, 2 twins in the other, and a pull out sofa bed. The rooms were clean and well kept. Only complaint is the bedsheets were really thin, but that is a very minor issue. The kitchen came in very handy as we were able to make breakfast in the morning and keep milk and fruit in the fridge for our 2 year old. The location was also great, right next to Robson Street with lots of shopping and restaurants close by. Staff in the lobby were very friendly. Highly recommend the hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jtthunder
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Carmana for a consistent 5 months on Business. This has become my 2nd home for that period. The staff is super friendly and always say hello when passing the front desk. It is clean and modern and the housekeeping staff is always friendly. There is a coin-op laundry on the third floor, and one huge perk is that they do your dry cleaning for free (there is a $5.00 daily accrual I think). The fitness centre is a joke however. Fintess Worls is a block away on Bute / W. Georgia. It is more like condo living as opposed to a hotel, but with daily maid service. The basic suite could use a better TV and a DVD player. I am amused that they still provide a VCR and want to charge a daily rate for a DVD player. The internet is free, but not wireless. Overall very comfortable, and FREE PARKING. not that you would need it, you can walk to everything. Another perk is the liquor store is right downstairs. Just plug your nose when passing Tim Horton's downstairs also. The many local bums use the sidewalk for a toilet, and the scent is noticable.

Reviews.Title: “great as a base to explore”
Reviews.Author: ramjudd
Reviews.Content: this was a good apartment base to explore Vancouver before we went on to ski at whistler. It was a good size with everything we needed. The staff were very helpful and its location meant that you could reach all the different tourist locations easily using local transport or just by walking

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: jac2028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carmana on and off for approximately 3 months for work. I travel a lot for work and this is my favorite hotel. The rooms are extremely spacious, the property is clean and everything is very private. You get free internet access and full cable and maid services. This does feel way more like an apartment than a hotel though but I found it far more comfortable. Being able to make my own food and have a lot of space was a definite plus. Be warned though on the Robson side of the building it can be noisy since a lot of dump trucks go through here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experiences with Carmana”
Reviews.Author: liberty3l
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carmana Plaza September 30, 2007 for three nights with my wife and 13yr old son. Booked hotel for three persons in a one bedroom apartment expecting to have a sofa or pull out bed for the boy. On arrival I was shocked after being advised that I had to pay and extra $15.00 a night for the pull out bed! After my expressions of dissapointment and embarassment in the main foyer I requested that I speak to the manager who saw that I was not impressed and offered the sofa bed all inclusive. I must say though that apart from the attempted rip off, I would stay again as the hotel was very clean, well located and serviced.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with the Carmana”
Reviews.Author: carrom
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of 4 and stayed in 3 different hotels in Vancouver (Times Square & Pacific Plaisades). This was our favourite for comfort, location and value. We had a very large 2 bed suite on 30th floor with small balcony. There were 2 bathrooms full of soaps etc , good kitchen with all amenities, TV , Hi-fis etc all over the place and very stylish minimalist decor. The hotel is right in the heart of the busy Robson St area and can be noisy with the windows open but is fun if you want to go for a stroll in the evening and be in the middle of the action. Also good for shopping, restaurants etc In fact you can walk almost anywhere. The lobby is also comfortable and stylish if you need to wait around and there are 3 lifts which get you to your room without having to wait. All in all a high quality suites/hotel which i wouldn't hesitate to recommend in its price range.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Happy_MM
Reviews.Content: Everytime we go to Vancouver, we always book Carmana Plaza because it's at a prime location, the staff are excellent to deal with and you get your very own fully furnished condo with equipped kitchen, LCD TV in the bedroom and living room plus it's located in the heart of downtown Vancouver close to Robson and a comfortable walking distance to Stanley Park. The price is super reasonable for what you get. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vancouver. I don't understand why this hotel is not ranked higher because it totally deserves it!

HotelInfo.Name: Carmana Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: 1128 Alberni Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 4R6, Canada
